ruleset.name: jpinpoint-common_std-rules
ruleset.description: jPinpoint rule set for performance aware Java coding, sponsored by Rabobank.

rule.name: AvoidApacheCommonsFileItemNonStreaming
rule.message: Avoid memory intensive FileItem.get and FileItem.getString
rule.description: Problem: Use of FileItem.get and FileItem.getString could exhaust memory since they load the entire file into memory Solution: Use streaming methods and buffering.

property.name: xpath

rule.name: AvoidCalendarDateCreation
rule.message: A Calendar is used to create a Date or DateTime, this is expensive.
rule.description: Problem: A Calendar is a heavyweight object and expensive to create. Solution: Use 'new Date()', Java 8+ java.time.[Local/Zoned]DateTime.now().

property.name: xpath

rule.name: AvoidConcatInAppend
rule.message: Concatenation inside append. Use extra append.
rule.description: Concatenation of Strings is used inside an StringBuilder.append argument. Problem: Each statement with one or more +-operators creates a hidden temporary StringBuilder, a char[] and a new String object, which all have to be garbage collected. Solution: Use an extra fluent append instead of concatenation.

rule.name: AvoidConcatInLoop
rule.message: A String is concatenated in a loop. Use StringBuilder.append.
rule.description: A String is built in a loop by concatenation. Problem: Each statement with one or more +-operators creates a hidden temporary StringBuilder, a char[] and a new String object, which all have to be garbage collected. Solution: Use the StringBuilder append method.

property.name: xpath

rule.name: LimitWildcardStaticImports
rule.message: The number of static imports with a wildcard should be limited
rule.description: Importing a class statically allows you to use its public static members easily: without qualifying them with the class name. Problem: if you import too many classes statically, your code can become confusing and difficult to maintain. The default maximum = 3. Solution: Import class members individually.

property.name: param-max
property.description: Maximum number of allowed static imports with wildcard

rule.name: LetFieldsMeetSerializable
rule.message: Fields in a Serializable class should be serializable or transient.
rule.description: Problem: Field in a Serializable class is not serializable nor transient. When (de)serialization happens, a RuntimeException will be thrown and (de)serialization fails. Solution: make the field either transient, make its class implement Serializable or interface extend Serializable. Note: Classes extending Throwable do, by inheritance, implement Serializable, yet are excluded in this rule, since they are typically never actually serialized. An exception to this exception is when extending RemoteException, then fields should be transient or serializable.

rule.name: LimitStatementsInLambdas
rule.message: Avoid many statements in lambda expressions.
rule.description: Problem: lambda expressions with many statements are hard to understand and maintain. Solution: extract the lambda expression code block into one or more well-named separate method(s).

property.name: param-max
property.description: Maximum number of allowed non-setter statements

property.name: xpath

rule.name: LimitNestingInLambdas
rule.message: Avoid deep nesting of lambdas in lambda expressions.
rule.description: Problem: lambda expressions with deep nesting (lambda's in lambda's) are hard to understand and maintain. Solution: extract the lambda expression code block(s) into one or more well-named separate method(s). Note: A violation when the depth of lambda-with-code-block nesting exceeds (by default) 1, or the depth of lambda-single-expression in lambda nesting exceeds (by default) 4.

property.name: param-block-max
property.description: Maximum allowed depth of lambda-with-code-block nesting

property.name: param-single-max
property.description: Maximum allowed depth of lambda-single-expression nesting

rule.description: Problem: Assignments to variables for which the assigned value is not used because a new value is assigned before actual use, is unnecessary work and may indicate a bug. Solution: remove the first assignment and make sure that is as intended.

rule.name: AvoidForEachInStreams
rule.message: Prefer side-effect-free functions in streams, use forEach only for logging.
rule.description: Problem: Streams is a paradigm based on functional programming: the result should depend only on its input and not update any state. Use of forEach is actually iterative code masquerading as streams code. It is typically harder to read and less maintainable than the iterative form. Solution: Use the for-each (enhanced-for) loop, or the pure functional form. The forEach operation should only be used to report (i.e. log) the result of a stream computation.
